intro: Psychotria pinnatinervia, commonly known as the pink-veined psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves with prominent pink veins, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. Psychotria pinnatinervia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
